verses.kjv: So all Israel were reckoned by genealogies; and, behold, they were written in the book of the kings of Israel and Judah, who were carried away to Babylon for their transgression.
verses.ct: So all of Israel was recorded in genealogies, and these were written down in the official records of the kings of Israel and Judah. The people of Judah were taken away to Babylon because of their unfaithfulness.

verses.kjv: Now the first inhabitants that dwelt in their possessions in their cities were, the Israelites, the priests, Levites, and the Nethinims.
verses.ct: The first people to resettle on their own property in their towns were ordinary Israelites, priests, Levites, and temple servants.

verses.kjv: And in Jerusalem dwelt of the children of Judah, and of the children of Benjamin, and of the children of Ephraim, and Manasseh;
verses.ct: Some of those who settled in Jerusalem came from the tribes of Judah, Benjamin, Ephraim, and Manasseh.

verses.kjv: Uthai the son of Ammihud, the son of Omri, the son of Imri, the son of Bani, of the children of Pharez the son of Judah.
verses.ct: From Judah there was Uthai son of Ammihud, son of Omri, son of Imri, son of Bani, a descendant of Pharez son of Judah.

verses.kjv: And of the Shilonites; Asaiah the firstborn, and his sons.
verses.ct: From the Shilonites there was Asaiah the firstborn, along with his sons.

verses.kjv: And of the sons of Zerah; Jeuel, and their brethren, six hundred and ninety.
verses.ct: From the descendants of Zerah there was Jeuel, along with their relatives — 690 in all.

verses.kjv: And of the sons of Benjamin; Sallu the son of Meshullam, the son of Hodaviah, the son of Hasenuah,
verses.ct: From Benjamin there was Sallu son of Meshullam, son of Hodaviah, son of Hasenuah,

verses.kjv: And Ibneiah the son of Jeroham, and Elah the son of Uzzi, the son of Michri, and Meshullam the son of Shephathiah, the son of Reuel, the son of Ibnijah;
verses.ct: along with Ibneiah son of Jeroham, Elah son of Uzzi son of Michri, and Meshullam son of Shephathiah son of Reuel son of Ibnijah.

verses.kjv: And their brethren, according to their generations, nine hundred and fifty and six. All these men were chief of the fathers in the house of their fathers.
verses.ct: Their relatives, as listed in their family records, numbered 956. All of these men were heads of their family clans.

verses.kjv: And of the priests; Jedaiah, and Jehoiarib, and Jachin,
verses.ct: Among the priests were Jedaiah, Jehoiarib, and Jachin,

verses.kjv: And Azariah the son of Hilkiah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Zadok, the son of Meraioth, the son of Ahitub, the ruler of the house of God;
verses.ct: along with Azariah son of Hilkiah, son of Meshullam, son of Zadok, son of Meraioth, son of Ahitub, who was the chief official of the house of God.

verses.kjv: And Adaiah the son of Jeroham, the son of Pashur, the son of Malchijah, and Maasiai the son of Adiel, the son of Jahzerah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Meshillemith, the son of Immer;
verses.ct: There was also Adaiah son of Jeroham, son of Pashur, son of Malchijah, and Maasiai son of Adiel, son of Jahzerah, son of Meshullam, son of Meshillemith, son of Immer.

verses.kjv: And their brethren, heads of the house of their fathers, a thousand and seven hundred and threescore; very able men for the work of the service of the house of God.
verses.ct: Their relatives, who were heads of their family clans, totaled 1,760 — all highly capable men responsible for the service of the house of God.

verses.kjv: And of the Levites; Shemaiah the son of Hasshub, the son of Azrikam, the son of Hashabiah, of the sons of Merari;
verses.ct: Among the Levites was Shemaiah son of Hasshub, son of Azrikam, son of Hashabiah, from the descendants of Merari.

verses.kjv: And Bakbakkar, Heresh, and Galal, and Mattaniah the son of Micah, the son of Zichri, the son of Asaph;
verses.ct: There were also Bakbakkar, Heresh, Galal, and Mattaniah son of Micah, son of Zichri, son of Asaph,

verses.kjv: And Obadiah the son of Shemaiah, the son of Galal, the son of Jeduthun, and Berechiah the son of Asa, the son of Elkanah, that dwelt in the villages of the Netophathites.
verses.ct: along with Obadiah son of Shemaiah, son of Galal, son of Jeduthun, and Berechiah son of Asa, son of Elkanah, who lived in the villages around Netophah.

verses.kjv: And the porters were, Shallum, and Akkub, and Talmon, and Ahiman, and their brethren: Shallum was the chief;
verses.ct: The gatekeepers were Shallum, Akkub, Talmon, and Ahiman, along with their relatives. Shallum served as their leader.

verses.kjv: Who hitherto waited in the king’s gate eastward: they were porters in the companies of the children of Levi.
verses.ct: Up to that time, they had been stationed at the king's gate on the east side. They were the gatekeepers assigned to the Levite divisions.

verses.kjv: And Shallum the son of Kore, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah, and his brethren, of the house of his father, the Korahites, were over the work of the service, keepers of the gates of the tabernacle: and their fathers, being over the host of the LORD, were keepers of the entry.
verses.ct: Shallum son of Kore, son of Ebiasaph, son of Korah, along with his relatives from the Korahite clan, were responsible for guarding the entrances to the tabernacle. Their ancestors had been in charge of the LORD's camp, guarding the way in.

verses.kjv: And Phinehas the son of Eleazar was the ruler over them in time past, and the LORD was with him.
verses.ct: In earlier times, Phinehas son of Eleazar had been the official in charge of them, and the LORD was with him.

verses.kjv: And Zechariah the son of Meshelemiah was porter of the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
verses.ct: Zechariah son of Meshelemiah served as gatekeeper at the entrance to the tent of meeting.

verses.kjv: All these which were chosen to be porters in the gates were two hundred and twelve. These were reckoned by their genealogy in their villages, whom David and Samuel the seer did ordain in their set office.
verses.ct: Altogether, 212 men were selected as gatekeepers. They were registered by genealogy in their villages. David and Samuel the prophet had appointed them to their permanent positions.

verses.kjv: So they and their children had the oversight of the gates of the house of the LORD, namely, the house of the tabernacle, by wards.
verses.ct: So they and their descendants were responsible for guarding the gates of the LORD's house — the tabernacle — by taking assigned shifts.

verses.kjv: In four quarters were the porters, toward the east, west, north, and south.
verses.ct: Gatekeepers were stationed on all 4 sides: east, west, north, and south.

verses.kjv: And their brethren, which were in their villages, were to come after seven days from time to time with them.
verses.ct: Their relatives in the surrounding villages would come in to serve alongside them for 7-day rotations at regular intervals.

verses.kjv: For these Levites, the four chief porters, were in their set office, and were over the chambers and treasuries of the house of God.
verses.ct: The 4 chief gatekeepers, who were Levites, held permanent positions and were also in charge of the rooms and storehouses of the house of God.

verses.kjv: And they lodged round about the house of God, because the charge was upon them, and the opening thereof every morning pertained to them.
verses.ct: They stayed overnight near the house of God because they were responsible for guarding it and for opening the doors each morning.

verses.kjv: And certain of them had the charge of the ministering vessels, that they should bring them in and out by tale.
verses.ct: Some of them were in charge of the items used in worship services, counting them when they were brought out and again when they were returned.

verses.kjv: Some of them also were appointed to oversee the vessels, and all the instruments of the sanctuary, and the fine flour, and the wine, and the oil, and the frankincense, and the spices.
verses.ct: Others were assigned to take care of the furnishings and all the equipment of the sanctuary, as well as the fine flour, wine, olive oil, frankincense, and spices.

verses.kjv: And some of the sons of the priests made the ointment of the spices.
verses.ct: Some of the priests' sons were responsible for mixing the fragrant ointment from the spices.

verses.kjv: And Mattithiah, one of the Levites, who was the firstborn of Shallum the Korahite, had the set office over the things that were made in the pans.
verses.ct: Mattithiah, one of the Levites and the firstborn of Shallum the Korahite, held the permanent responsibility for baking the offerings prepared on flat pans.

verses.kjv: And other of their brethren, of the sons of the Kohathites, were over the shewbread, to prepare it every sabbath.
verses.ct: Some of their relatives from the Kohathite clan were in charge of preparing the bread of the Presence, setting it out fresh every Sabbath.

verses.kjv: And these are the singers, chief of the fathers of the Levites, who remaining in the chambers were free: for they were employed in that work day and night.
verses.ct: The musicians, who were heads of Levite families, lived in rooms at the temple and were exempt from other duties because their work kept them busy day and night.

verses.kjv: These chief fathers of the Levites were chief throughout their generations; these dwelt at Jerusalem.
verses.ct: These were the heads of the Levite families, leaders according to their genealogies. They lived in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And in Gibeon dwelt the father of Gibeon, Jehiel, whose wife’s name was Maachah,
verses.ct: Jehiel, the founder of Gibeon, lived in Gibeon. His wife's name was Maachah.

verses.kjv: And his firstborn son Abdon, then Zur, and Kish, and Baal, and Ner, and Nadab,
verses.ct: His firstborn son was Abdon, followed by Zur, Kish, Baal, Ner, and Nadab,

verses.kjv: And Gedor, and Ahio, and Zechariah, and Mikloth.
verses.ct: then Gedor, Ahio, Zechariah, and Mikloth.

verses.kjv: And Mikloth begat Shimeam. And they also dwelt with their brethren at Jerusalem, over against their brethren.
verses.ct: Mikloth became the father of Shimeam. They also lived near their relatives in Jerusalem, right alongside them.

verses.kjv: And Ner begat Kish; and Kish begat Saul; and Saul begat Jonathan, and Malchishua, and Abinadab, and Eshbaal.
verses.ct: Ner became the father of Kish, Kish became the father of Saul, and Saul became the father of Jonathan, Malchishua, Abinadab, and Eshbaal.

verses.kjv: And the son of Jonathan was Meribbaal: and Meribbaal begat Micah.
verses.ct: Jonathan's son was Meribbaal, and Meribbaal became the father of Micah.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Micah were, Pithon, and Melech, and Tahrea, and Ahaz.
verses.ct: Micah's sons were Pithon, Melech, Tahrea, and Ahaz.

verses.kjv: And Ahaz begat Jarah; and Jarah begat Alemeth, and Azmaveth, and Zimri; and Zimri begat Moza;
verses.ct: Ahaz became the father of Jarah. Jarah became the father of Alemeth, Azmaveth, and Zimri. Zimri became the father of Moza.

verses.kjv: And Moza begat Binea; and Rephaiah his son, Eleasah his son, Azel his son.
verses.ct: Moza became the father of Binea. Binea's son was Rephaiah, whose son was Eleasah, whose son was Azel.

verses.kjv: And Azel had six sons, whose names are these, Azrikam, Bocheru, and Ishmael, and Sheariah, and Obadiah, and Hanan: these were the sons of Azel.
verses.ct: Azel had 6 sons: Azrikam, Bocheru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, and Hanan. These were the sons of Azel.
